reasoning: Reporting incidence. Transitional cell carcinoma (urothelial carcinoma) primarily affects bladder (>90% of cases). GLOBOCAN 2002 data shows bladder cancer incidence ~10.1 per 100k globally, with higher rates in males.
source: Parkin DM et al. (2005). Global cancer statistics, 2002. CA Cancer J Clin. 55(2):74-108
